title: Trapping Rain Water
description: Given an array of non-negative integers representing the height of bars, compute how much water can be trapped after raining. The width of each bar is 1.
input_format: An array of integers heights where heights[i] represents the height of the ith bar.
output_format: An integer representing the total amount of water trapped.

examples.explanation: The water trapped can be visualized as 1 unit above heights[2], 2 units above heights[4] and 3 units above heights[7]. Total: 1 + 2 + 3 = 6.
Water is trapped above the bars with heights 2 and 3. The total units of water trapped is 9.

hints: Think about the water that can be trapped above each bar.
Consider using two pointers to find boundaries.
Remember to keep track of the maximum heights from both left and right.

title: Sort an Array
description: Given an array of integers, your task is to sort the array in non-decreasing order. You need to implement a function that will take the array as input and return the sorted array.
output_format: An array of integers representing the sorted order of the input array.

examples.explanation: The sorted order of the given array is [1, 2, 3, 5, 8].
The sorted order of the given array is [-1, 0, 2, 3, 10].

hints: Consider using a built-in sorting function.
Think about the time complexity of different sorting algorithms.
